musicRepresentation

Class KeySignature

  • java.lang.Object
    • musicRepresentation.KeySignature

  • public class KeySignature
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents accidentals as a Map in a key signature. It is an immutable class.
    Author:
    Nicholas M. Mizoguchi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeySignature(java.lang.String keyName)
      Creates a new KeySignature object with the keyName.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getKeyName() 
      java.util.Map<Pitch,Pitch> getPitchMap()
      Gives a Map that matches each pitch correctly to its shift, that is represented by an integer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeySignature

        public KeySignature(java.lang.String keyName)
        Creates a new KeySignature object with the keyName. keyName defines the mapping of pitchMap. Considered valid key signatures are the ones in the circle of fifths (also enharmonics). If the key is invalid an IllegalArgument exception is raised.
        Parameters:
        keyName - a valid key signature for the music.

    • Method Detail

      • getPitchMap

        public java.util.Map<Pitch,Pitch> getPitchMap()
        Gives a Map that matches each pitch correctly to its shift, that is represented by an integer. It represents up to 5 octaves for each key.
        Returns:
        Copy of pitchMap

      • getKeyName

        public java.lang.String getKeyName()
